OpenFeint Class Reference

OpenFeint bridge. The methods can be called directly from your scripts. Example: OpenFeint.LaunchDashboard(OpenFeint.eDashboardPage.Leaderboards);. More...

List of all members.

  Main, Leaderboards, Achievements, Challenges,
  FindFriends, WhosPlaying, GlobalChatRooms, GameChatRooms,
  SwitchUser

static void SubmitChallengeResult (Gree.Unity.CallbackFetcherOpenFeint.eChallengeResult result, string resultDescription)
 Submits the result of a played challenge to the server. This should always be called after the challenge game play session is over, regardless of the result or the type of challenge. It should be called before DisplayChallengeCompletedModal.

Detailed Description

OpenFeint bridge. The methods can be called directly from your scripts. Example: OpenFeint.LaunchDashboard(OpenFeint.eDashboardPage.Leaderboards);.

static void OpenFeint.ClearCallbacks ( ) [inline, static]
static void OpenFeint.DisplayChallengeCompletedModalWithFile ( Gree.Unity.CallbackFetcherOpenFeint.eChallengeResult  result,
string  resultDescription,
string  reChallengeDescription,
string  reChallengeDataFilePath 
) [inline, static]

Displays the modal for showing the result of the challenge and allows for the user to re-challenge (if it was a multi-attempt challenge). Call SubmitChallengeResult BEFORE calling this.

Parameters:
resultThe result of the challenge.
resultDescriptionRA string that will be prefixed by either the recipient's name or "You", depending on the player that is viewing the result. It should not contain whether the recipient won or lost, but should contain the statistics of his attempt. (Ex. "beat 30 monsters" will turn into "You beat 30 monsters")
reChallengeDescriptionIf the user decides to send out the result as a re-challenge, this will be the description for the new challenge. It should display what needs to be fulfilled to complete the challenge. Only used by multi-attempt challenges.
reChallengeDataFilePathTells the native code how/where to access the challenge data if the user decides to send out a "re-challenge". Only used for multi-attempt challenges.
static void OpenFeint.DisplayChallengeCompletedModalWithPlayerPrefs ( Gree.Unity.CallbackFetcherOpenFeint.eChallengeResult  result,
string  resultDescription,
string  reChallengeDescription,
string[]  reChallengeDataKeys 
) [inline, static]

Displays the modal for showing the result of the challenge and allows for the user to re-challenge (if it was a multi-attempt challenge). Call SubmitChallengeResult BEFORE calling this.

Parameters:
resultThe result of the challenge.
resultDescriptionA string that will be prefixed by either the recipient's name or "You", depending on the player that is viewing the result. It should not contain whether the recipient won or lost, but should contain the statistics of his attempt. (Ex. "beat 30 monsters" will turn into "You beat 30 monsters")
reChallengeDescriptionIf the user decides to send out the result as a re-challenge, this will be the description for the new challenge. It should display what needs to be fulfilled to complete the challenge. Only used by multi-attempt challenges.
reChallengeDataKeysTells the native code how/where to access the challenge data if the user decides to send out a "re-challenge". Only used for multi-attempt challenges.
static void OpenFeint.DisplaySendChallengeModalWithFile ( string  challengeId,
string  challengeText,
string  dataFilePath 
) [inline, static]

Displays the modal for sending a challenge to another player.

Parameters:
challengeIdhe ID of the challenge.
challengeTextCDisplays what needs to be fulfilled to complete the challenge.
dataFilePathThe path to a file located in the app's Documents directory that contains the challenge data. This is the preferred method for serialized XML data (Unity iPhone Advanced only).

static void OpenFeint.DisplaySendChallengeModalWithPlayerPrefs ( string  challengeId,
string  challengeText,
string[]  dataKeys 
) [inline, static]

Displays the modal for sending a challenge to another player.

Parameters:
challengeIdThe ID of the challenge.
challengeTextDisplays what needs to be fulfilled to complete the challenge.
dataKeysAn array of PlayerPrefs keys where the data for this challenge is stored. This will be packaged up an sent as the challenge data from this player.

) [inline, static]
static void OpenFeint.DownloadBlobToFilePath ( string  blobKey,
string  filePath,
Gree.Unity.CallbackFetcherOpenFeint.DeferredResultDelegate  callback 
) [inline, static]

Download a previously uploaded data blob from the "cloud".

Parameters:
blobKeyThe key of the blob you wish to download from the cloud.
filePathA path to a file in the app's Documents directory that you wish to be populated with the downloaded blob contents. This is the preferred method if using serialized XML data (Unity iPhone Advanced only).
callbackCalled whenever the action returns success or failure. CANNOT be 'null'.
static void OpenFeint.DownloadBlobToPlayerPrefs ( string  blobKey,
string[]  playerPrefsKeys,
Gree.Unity.CallbackFetcherOpenFeint.DeferredResultDelegate  callback 
) [inline, static]

Download a previously uploaded data blob from the "cloud".

Events : OnUploadedCloudBlob

Parameters:
blobKeyThe key of the blob you wish to download from the cloud.
playerPrefsKeysAn array of PlayerPrefs keys that will be populated with the downloaded blob data.
callbackCalled whenever the action returns success or failure. CANNOT be 'null'.
static void OpenFeint.DownloadHighScorePayload ( string  leaderboardId,
string  scoreKey 
) [inline, static]

It downloads the high score blob for given score key.

Parameters:
leaderboardIdLeaderboard identifier.
scoreKeyScore built key. It is : string(score.leaderboardId) + '-' + string(score.rank)

static void OpenFeint.SubmitChallengeResult ( Gree.Unity.CallbackFetcherOpenFeint.eChallengeResult  result,
string  resultDescription 
) [inline, static]

Submits the result of a played challenge to the server. This should always be called after the challenge game play session is over, regardless of the result or the type of challenge. It should be called before DisplayChallengeCompletedModal.

Events : OnChallengeResultSubmitted

Parameters:
resultThe result of the challenge.
resultDescriptionA string that will be prefixed by either the recipient's name or "You", depending on the player that is viewing the result. It should not contain whether the recipient won or lost, but should contain the statistics of his attempt. (Ex. "beat 30 monsters" will turn into "You beat 30 monsters")

string  displayText,
string  leaderboardId,
bool  silently 
) [inline, static]

Submit a high score to a specific leaderboard.

Parameters:
scoreThe integer score.
displayTextThe text to display for this score instead of the integer score value.
leaderboardIdString containing the leaderboard ID where the score is to be submitted.
silentlyWhether or not to display a notification upon successful high score submission.

Property Documentation

bool OpenFeint.allowNotifications [static, get, set]

GSet/get whether or not we are allowing OpenFeint notifications.

true if allow notifications; otherwise, false.

bool OpenFeint.hasUserApprovedFeint [static, get]

Check whether or not the local user has approved use of OpenFeint.

true if user has approved feint; otherwise, false.

bool OpenFeint.isOnline [static, get]

Check whether or not the local user is online.

true if is online; otherwise, false.

Get the user ID of the local user.

The local user ID.

Get the user name of the local user.

The name of the local user.

The number of unviewed challenges when the user logged in.

The number of unviewed challenges at login.
